posts.name: durga
posts.cooked:
PUNKT are a manufacturers of 4G feature phones in Switzerland. They claim that Signal works in their phones through some PIGEON software.
Can someone please elaborate on what this is???

Hi

Punkt

Punkt. MP02 Pigeon

The Punkt. MP02 4G mobile phone is built for connecting with people. Featured with a minimalist interface, cool and stylish design. Shop now!

punkt.ch

26702-MP02%20-%20Pigeon%20User%20Manual%20%28EN%29.pdf

380.87 KB

posts.name: Robert Picciotti
posts.cooked: This is rather interesting. No word of it from Signal as far as I can tell, so presumably an unofficial client. Also no sign that I can see in a quick search that the Pigeon client is open source. I have to wonder if it’s compliant with GPLv3, though I’m not well versed in how GPL licensing works.

From Punkt. MP02 Pigeon

It’s actually based on AOSP 8.1, so they probably use the Signal APK unchanged. If they don’t they would have to release the sources.

posts.name: durga
posts.cooked:
punkt.ch is making factual claims of being associated with SIGNAL in some way.
SIGNAL must respond to this to dispel any uncertainty in this regard.

posts.name: durga
posts.cooked:
Whatever it is.!!
SIGNAL has to clear the air on this.
The name SIGNAL implies Privacy, Safety and Security.
There has to be an official statement from SIGNAL.

It seems that they modified the Signal Android app to work on a small screen device and just have that installed on their device. They use Signal’s name a lot (which is trademarked) but they seem to use it in a relatively fair way (aka: no legal action can be taken). They say that they ported Signal not that they’re working with the Signal Org.
I think it’s probably fair game, but also I don’t think the Signal team has time to go after them for no particular reason. I also think their site is pretty clear so I don’t quite see why they need to ‘clear the air’.
Also they usually don’t issue many official statements if at all on things like this, just a small project from some companies.
Does anyone here have the Punkt MP02 phone? How do you like it and how is the Signal performance?

I ordered one and am excited to use it! Am a little sad they haven’t thought of a way to link it to desktop, even just a crappy camera in the back or something or to link the mp02 as a secondary device (maybe that last one is a technical hindrence).

posts.name: G
posts.cooked:
Punkt is a Swiss company. They have the MP02 4g mobile phone. This uses a stripped down version of signal for android. (The core OS is android)
I use signal on my iPhone and iPad however cannot link the mp02 as there is no collaboration between signal Org and Punkt.

Could this happen please as I can then get rid of my iPhone and just use iPad and Punkt phone

posts.name: Ahmet T.
posts.cooked:
Hello first of all,

What connection do you mean? What version of Signal does the MP02 use?

Did the company make its own implementation (I mean the server side)?

If you share a little more technical information, I’ll try to help.

Take it easy.

Punkt/Pigeon has been discussed a few months back on this thread:

Signal through Pigeon in Punkt feature phones General Discussion
PUNKT are a manufacturers of 4G feature phones in Switzerland. They claim that Signal works in their phones through some PIGEON software. Can someone please elaborate on what this is???

Seems that they provide their own client

Edit: was merged from different thread, hence now self-referencing

posts.name: do
posts.cooked:
Just like @125f8 said earlier, I’d love to get rid of my iPhone and move to Punkt.

But I need Signal a lot and use it from my laptop all day through.

If Signal would add another way to link a device apart from scanning a QR (entering a long string of random digits or so), this could be a big step forward.

I returned my punkt as there were just some things I did not have an alternative for. I need maps as I live in a city I am not very known and use a music streaming service, which you can’t use on there. I thought of using my iPhone as an option to use as an iPod, but why then not just use the iPhone. Now I just block safari, or just websites I frequent, when I need a browser at hand.

Signal wasn’t perfect on it either. It was able to use @ but then you couldn’t choose a contact and a couple of those small annoyances. I’d love to try again when they release a new version (or another brand) which solves some of these issues.

I liked a lot about it too, the size, the screen. Just needs to be refined for my whishes, but then I am quite perfectionist in what I want.

The Pigeon Client is Open source, you can find the source code on Github:

GitHub

GitHub - Punkt-Tronics-AG/Pigeon: A private messenger for Android.

A private messenger for Android. Contribute to Punkt-Tronics-AG/Pigeon development by creating an account on GitHub.

Also, they clearly state directly on the first page about pigeon:
“Note: Pigeon is an independent creation and has not been endorsed by The Signal Technology Foundation”
So I don’t really see a problem here, rather an interesting project. If it wasn’t that expensive, I’d buy one. There are more and more people moving to dumb phones to be less distracted in everyday life. My problem with that has always been privacy. dumb phones usually are only capable of SMS and calls, sometimes maybe whatsapp, but that is horrible as well. So i see it as an amazing developmend and wish them lots of success.

I tried to get the Pigeon app (signal) but couldn’t because you need to complete the captcha and doing so on the phone isn’t easy, people have said to use a mouse via Bluetooth even then it’s not easy and so I won’t use the mp02 for Pigeon just use it as a phone.
